00042 struct Cookie: public Ice::LocalObject {
00043     string entity;
00044     int msg_id;
00045 };
00046 typedef IceUtil::Handle<Cookie> CookiePtr;
00047 
00048 //!The call back object for the Put and Get AMI.
00049 /**
00050  * Ice calls the finished method once the AMI completes. The
00051  * client is not tied to any particular call back. The actual
00052  * call back is provided by a helper class, the sync_helper
00053  * whose end method is called to complete the full AMI call.
00054  *
00055  * This call back class also doubles up as a rate limiter
00056  * implementing a sliding window mechanism for sending
00057  * messages to the server.
00058  *
00059  * Given a max number of msgs, it creates an array to track
00060  * the status of the msgs that have been sent to the server
00061  *
00062  * It provides a monitor based wait mechanism for the client
00063  * which can wait till the server responds back to a particular
00064  * msg. We take the liberty of making a fcfs assumption on the
00065  * server side processing for keeping things simple.
00066  */
00067 class PNGCallback: public IceUtil::Shared {
00068 public:
00069     //!The sync_helper and the max num of msgs to track
00070     PNGCallback(Synchronizer_Helper& sync_helper, int num_msgs) :
00071         _sync_helper(sync_helper), _num_msgs(num_msgs) {
00072         _num_synchs = 0;
00073         _waiting = -1;
00074         _status = new bool[_num_msgs];
00075         for (int i = 0; i < _num_msgs; i++) {
00076             _status[i] = true;
00077         }
00078     }
00079 
00080     ~PNGCallback() {
00081         delete[] _status;
00082     }
00083 
00084     //!Wait till the server responds to msg with id msg_id
00085     bool wait_till_done(int msg_id) {
00086         if (_status[msg_id])
00087             return true;
00088         IceUtil::Monitor<IceUtil::Mutex>::Lock lock(_monitor);
00089         while (!_status[msg_id]) {
00090             try {
00091                 _waiting = msg_id;
00092                 _monitor.wait();
00093                 _waiting = -1;
00094             } catch (const Ice::Exception& ex) {
00095                 _waiting = -1;
00096                 throw ex;
00097             }
00098         }
00099         return true;
00100     }
00101 
00102     //!set or clear the status flag for a particular msg_id
00103     void set_done(int msg_id, bool status) {
00104         _status[msg_id] = status;
00105     }
00106 
00107     //!Provides the number of completed AMI callbacks
00108     int num_synchs() {
00109         return _num_synchs;
00110     }
00111 
00112     /**
00113      * This method is called by Ice run time when the server
00114      * responds. We do some bookkeeping and delegate the
00115      * task of actually completing the AMI by calling
00116      * sync_helper.end method
00117      */
00118     void finished(const Ice::AsyncResultPtr& r) {
00119         DistributedMapPrx dist_map = DistributedMapPrx::uncheckedCast(
00120                 r->getProxy());
00121         string global_cnts;
00122         CookiePtr cookie = CookiePtr::dynamicCast(r->getCookie());
00123         int msg_id = cookie->msg_id;
00124         string entity = cookie->entity;
00125         try {
00126             dist_map->end_putNget(global_cnts, r);
00127         } catch (const Ice::Exception& ex) {
00128             throw ex;
00129         }
00130         _sync_helper.end_putNget(entity, global_cnts);
00131         ++_num_synchs;
00132         IceUtil::Monitor<IceUtil::Mutex>::Lock lock(_monitor);
00133         _status[msg_id] = true;
00134         if (_waiting == msg_id) {
00135             _monitor.notify();
00136         }
00137     }
00138 
00139 private:
00140     Synchronizer_Helper& _sync_helper;
00141     int _num_msgs, _num_synchs;
00142     bool *_status;
00143     int _waiting;
00144     IceUtil::Monitor<IceUtil::Mutex> _monitor;
00145 };
00146 typedef IceUtil::Handle<PNGCallback> PNGCallbackPtr;
00147 
00148 //!The client used to access the Distributed Map
00149 /**
00150  * Wrapper class to delegate the Distributed Map
00151  * operations to the appropriate Server
00152  */
00153 class DM_Client: public Client {
00154 public:
00155      /**
00156        * The servers in the Distributed Map setup
00157        * The max number of entities that you are going to
00158        * store in the map. This is just to make sure that
00159        * things dont break when you are processing a very small
00160        * number of entities particularly smaller than MAX_MSGS
00161        * The helper class that provides the actual call back functionality
00162        */
00163     DM_Client(int num_entities, const string& servers,
00164             Synchronizer_Helper& sync_helper);
00165     virtual ~DM_Client();
00166 
00167     //!The usual map operations
00168     void put(const string& entity, const string& delta);
00169     void set(const string& entity, const string& counts);
00170     bool get(const string& entity, string& counts);
00171     bool remove(const string& entity, string& counts);
00172 
00173     //!Start the asynchronous putNget operation
00174     void begin_putNget(const string& entity, const string& delta);
00175 
00176     //!Execute a barrier
00177     void wait_for_all();
00178 
00179     void wait_till_done();
00180 
00181     int get_num_servers();
00182 
00183 private:
00184     void add_server(const string& servant_name, const string& server_endpoint);
00185     inline size_t get_server(const string& s);
00186 
00187 private:
00188     Ice::CommunicatorPtr _ic;
00189     vector<DistributedMapPrx> _dist_maps;
00190     Ice::CallbackPtr _cb;
00191     PNGCallbackPtr _png_cb;
00192     int NUM_SERVERS, _num_entities;
00193     boost::hash<string> _hasher;
00194     size_t _cur_msg_id, _max_msgs;
00195 };
00196 
00197 #endif /* DM_CLIENT_H_ */
